dymm.mod.configuration.error.message: An error has occurred while attempting to display the in-game configuration GUI, no further information.
dymm.mod.configuration.error.title: Unable to Retrieve Configuration
dymm.mod.configuration._main.tooltip: Handles configuration that is specific to DYMM behavior
dymm.mod.configuration._main.debug.toolt: Set of options useful for developers: you generally want these to be set to false
dymm.mod.configuration._main.foolery.too: Some random features that aren't part of the mod, but may be fun to enable and play around with nonetheless
dymm.mod.configuration._main.performance: Allows you to configure some mod behavior, allowing you to prioritize speed over efficiency or vice versa
dymm.mod.configuration._targets.tooltip: Allows you to configure which mod targets DYMM should attempt to document
Set here which targets should be enabled or not.\nNote that not all targets present here may also have entries in game.\nNOTE: Certain targets may require additional configuration
dymm.mod.support.documentation_newer_tha: Documentation is for a newer version
dymm.mod.support.documentation_out_of_da: Documentation may be out of date
dymm.mod.configuration.inspirations.tool: Allows you to configure Inspirations-specific behavior
dymm.mod.configuration.inspirations.targ: Configures which category of targets should be documented inside Inspirations
dymm.doc.inspirations.decoration.buildin: Books come in all the different spectrum colors: they can be used to decorate bookshelves of the Default kind in specific arrangements.

Variant of leaves with little lights intertwined that emit light.

Useful for holiday decorations.

They come in white, red, green, blue, rainbow, and Christmas variants.
Acts like their vanilla counterpart, except that it's see through.\n\nRequires a tool enchanted with Silk Touch to be picked up, like Normal Glass.
Decorative block available in 4 variants (Bricks, Rocks, Round, and Tiles) that can be placed on the floor.
Carpets adapt to the shape of the block if placed on Stairs.
dymm.doc.inspirations.decoration.utility: Acts exactly like a button, but it blends seamlessly with Bricks or Nether Bricks, for more camouflaged triggers.
Variant of Trapdoor that blends seamlessly with other carpets, but it can be opened freely.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.building.books: This is the Ancient version, where books have colors that range from brown to tan and have an Adventure-like feel to them.

Alternative bookshelf that can be filled with books and provides an enchanting table bonus, which can reach 1.5, with a bookshelf full of normal books, or 2.5, with a bookshelf full of enchanted books (For reference: 1 is the vanilla enchanting table bonus).\n\nComes in all wood variants and in 4 different types that differ on the looks of books: Default, Rainbow, Tomes, and Ancient.
This is the Default version, which has books that are of random size and take the color of the book in the slot.
This is the Rainbow version, which has books whose colors go from red to purple in order.
This is the Tomes version, where all the books look the same and are of the same size.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.building.mulch: Gravity-affected block that can sustain most plants that can be placed on Dirt or Grass, but not saplings.\n\nIt comes in different colors.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.building.rope_: Right-clicking on it with Iron Nuggets turns it into a hanging ladder.

Decorative form of ladders that can be attached to the bottom of most blocks.\n\nRight-clicking on a rope with a rope of the same type will place the rope at the bottom of the current rope, extending it downwards.
Right-clicking on it with Sticks turns it into a hanging ladder.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.recipes.better: Used in conjuction with a Cauldron to store or place back dyed water.
Used in conjuction with a Cauldron to create a Lingering Potion from a potion liquid present in the cauldron itself.
Used in conjuction with a Cauldron to create a Splash Potion from a potion liquid present in the cauldron itself.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.baromete: Allows you to determine your altitude in world.\n\nThe glass capsule will go from completely full when at the bottom of the world, to almost empty at the top of the world. For reference, sea level is when the glass capsule is half full.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.beacon_c: Binding a Beacon Compass to a Beacon with a right-click, will make the compass point to the beacon location instead of world spawn.\n\nThis also works across dimensions.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.charged_: Arrows that do less damage but are able to power the block they land on for 10 redstone ticks.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.crook.bl: Additionally, this crook can light mobs on fire.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.crook.cr: Crooks are a useful tool when breaking leaves, as they increase the chance of a sapling to drop.\n\nAdditionally, they can also be used to pull back mobs.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.crook.wi: Additionally, this crook can inflict the Wither effect on mobs.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.lock_and:
Used to unlock containers, such as chests.

Before being effective, it must be renamed in an Anvil.

Can only open locks with a matching name.

Shift-right-clicking allows you to remove the lock.

Used to lock containers, such as chests.

Before being effective, it must be renamed in an Anvil.

Can only be opened with a key with a matching name.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.north_co: Variant of the compass that always points to the true North.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.photomet: Shows the light level at the current player position or at the block being targeted if held in the main hand.\n\nThe bottom of the texture is yellow in safe levels and red in dangerous levels.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tools.redstone: Produces a short redstone pulse of 10 redstone ticks (or 1 redstone tick, if shift-right-clicked) that strongly powers the targeted block and weakly power the blocks around it.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.tweaks.heartbe: Give 5 seconds of regeneration when eaten.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.utility.collec: Able to pull items from the world and inventories, like the Hopper, but that can be placed in all six directions and that requires a redstone pulse to work, like a Dropper.\n\nRequires a Hopper to extract items from its internal inventory.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.utility.pipe.p: Cheaper and more efficient version of the Hopper, can transport items in all directions (including upwards). It is unable to extract items from inventories, though, requiring a hopper to begin the chain.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.utility.redsto: Can be filled with redstone dust and its output can be read by a comparator.\n\nAllows more fine-grained control than the Cauldron, allowing the block to be filled with varying levels of Redstone Dust, from 0 to 15.
Lever that outputs power only to the block that it is attached on.\n\nMoreover, it is highly sensible to redstone level changes, making it able to be toggled with other redstone pulses.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.utility.torch_: Mixes the features of a Lever and a Torch, being able to produce redstone power when activated, but also giving off light.
dymm.doc.inspirations.mod.utility.trappe: When placed in a bookshelf, it allows the bookshelf to give off power, ranging from a strength of 2, when the book is in the first slot, to a strength of 15, when the book is in the last slot.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.building.s: Shearing the bottom block of one of the two-high flowers will drop two flowers of the small version of them.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.recipes.an: Anvils that land on blocks may smash them, either breaking them or turning them into softer blocks.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.recipes.be: Cauldrons can hold any type of liquids, not only water, and tossing items in them enables an additional form of crafting.\n\nNote that hot liquids can harm entities that fall into the cauldron.

If placed on top of fire, cauldrons can be used to brew potions.

Additionally, stepping into the cauldron with a potion in it will cause the effect to be applied to the entity.

Breaking the cauldron while it holds a potion liquid will also leave a lingering effect in its place.
Stews and soups can also be cooked inside the cauldron.
Dispensers can fill Cauldrons with liquids.
Dyed water stored in Cauldrons can then be used to dye armor or bottled up for successive use inside Dyed Water Bottles.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tools.axe_: Axes can be enchanted with more weapon-specific enchantments, like Fire Aspect, Knockback, and Looting.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tools.harv: Shearing a Vine will also automatically shear all the Vines that hang from it, instead of destroying them.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tools.melo: Shearing a Melon Block will let it drop all 9 slices instead of only a few.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tools.shie: Shields can now be enchanted, both in the enchanting table and from books in the anvil.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.bet: The Flower Pot can host all kinds of flowers and saplings, even modded ones.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.col: The ribbon on the Enchanted Book changes color depending on the rarity of the enchantment, with red identifying common ones, orange uncommon, green rare, and purple extremely rare.
The stripes on the firework identify the color of the first star.\nThe color of the tip identifies the second star.\nThe fuse color depends on the firework duration.
Placing Stained Glass under a column of portal blocks will tint them with the color of the Stained Glass.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.des: Pigs can be desaddled via a shift-right-click.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.dis: Dispensers attempt to place anvils instead of simply firing them.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.mor: Using Bone Meal on Dirt that is near a Grass Block or Mycelium has a chance of making Grass or Mycelium spread faster onto the targeted Dirt block.
Using Bone Meal on Mycelium has a chance to spawn Red and Brown Mushrooms.
Using Bone Meal on Sand has a chance to spawn Dead Bushes.
Blinds the target, restricting its viewing radius and making it more susceptible to attacks.
Inflicts the Wither effect on the target, draining its health up until the end of the effect.\n\nThe target can be killed in the process.
The target is limited in the movement speed, making mining and attacking more difficult.
Inflicts Food Poisoning on the target, making its food bar drain much faster.
The target starts to levitate as if it were hit by a Shulker.\nDoes not prevent fall damage when the potion ends.
Makes the target more resilient to attacks.
Dropped by Silverfishes, with a very small chance.
Dropped by Wither Skeletons, with a very small chance.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.tweaks.ske: Skeletons have a (very small) chance to drop their skull on death.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.utility.ca: Placing a carpet on top of a Stone Pressure Plate conceals it, making it harder to see.
dymm.doc.inspirations.vanilla.utility.di: Dispensers can fill vanilla and modded Fluid Tanks when they are placed right against it.
dymm.doc.ironchest.crystal: You can see the contained items from outside the GUI.
dymm.doc.ironchest.diamond: 9 rows of 12 slots for a total of 108 slots.
dymm.doc.ironchest.gold: 9 rows of 9 slots for a total of 81 slots.
dymm.doc.ironchest.iron: 6 rows of 9 slots for a total of 54 slots.
dymm.doc.ironchest.silver: 8 rows of 9 slots for a total of 72 slots.
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.copper_: 對銅箱按右鍵，將其變為鐵箱，而不會將其打破。
對銅箱按右鍵，將其變為銀箱，而不會將其打破。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.diamond: Right click on a Diamond Chest to turn it into a Crystal Chest without breaking it.
Right click on a Diamond Chest to turn it into an Obsidian Chest without breaking it.
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.gold_to: Right click on a Gold Chest to turn it into a Diamond Chest without breaking it.
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.iron_to: Right click on an Iron Chest to turn it into a Gold Chest without breaking it.
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.silver_: Right click on a Silver Chest to turn it into a Gold Chest without breaking it.
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.chest.wood_to: Right click on a Chest to turn it into an Iron Chest without breaking it.
對箱子按右鍵，將其變為銅箱，而不會將其打破。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.c: 對銅製界伏盒按右鍵，將其變為鐵製界伏盒，而不會將其打破。
對銅製界伏盒按右鍵，將其變為銀製界伏盒，而不會將其打破。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.d: 右鍵點擊鑽石界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成水晶界伏盒。
右鍵點擊鑽石界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成黑曜石界伏盒。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.g: 右鍵點擊金製界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成鑽石界伏盒。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.i: 右鍵點擊鐵製界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成金製界伏盒。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.s: 右鍵點擊銀製界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成金製界伏盒。
dymm.doc.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.w: 右鍵點擊界伏盒，在不破壞的情況下將其變成鐵製界伏盒。
對界伏盒按右鍵，將其變為銅製界伏盒，而不會將其打破。
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.copper_: 用於將銅箱升級為鐵箱
用於將銅箱升級為銀箱
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.diamond: Used to upgrade a Diamond Chest to a Crystal Chest
Used to upgrade a Diamond Chest to an Obsidian Chest
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.gold_to: Used to upgrade a Gold Chest to an Iron Chest
Used to upgrade a Gold Chest to a Diamond Chest
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.iron_to: Used to upgrade an Iron Chest to a Gold Chest
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.silver_: Used to upgrade a Silver Chest to a Gold Chest
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.chest.wood_to: Used to upgrade a wooden Chest to an Iron Chest
用於將存物箱升級為銅箱
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.c: 用於將銅製界伏盒升級為鐵製界伏盒
用於將銅製界伏盒升級為銀製界伏盒
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.d: 用於將鑽石界伏盒升級為水晶界伏盒
用於將鑽石界伏盒升級為黑曜石界伏盒
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.g: 用於將金製界伏盒升級為鐵製界伏盒
用於將金製界伏盒升級為鑽石界伏盒
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.i: 用於將鐵製界伏盒升級為金製界伏盒
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.s: 用於將銀製界伏盒升級為金製界伏盒
dymm.tip.ironchest.upgrade.shulker_box.w: 用於將木製界伏盒升級為鐵製界伏盒
用於將木製界伏盒升級為銅製界伏盒
dymm.doc.metalchests.chest.diamond: 6 rows of 18 slots for a total of 108 slots.
dymm.doc.metalchests.chest.gold: 5 rows of 16 slots for a total of 80 slots.
dymm.doc.metalchests.chest.iron: 6 rows of 9 slots for a total of 54 slots.
dymm.doc.metalchests.chest.silver: 6 rows of 12 slots for a total of 72 slots.
dymm.doc.naturescompass.naturescompass: Use to open a list of biomes. Select one from the list and the Compass will point towards the nearest instance of that biome.
dymm.mod.configuration.quark.tooltip: Allows you to configure Quark-specific behavior
dymm.mod.configuration.quark.targets.too: Configures which category of targets should be documented inside Quark
Building block that has the log texture on all sides.\nComes in all different variants.\nParticurarly useful for wood-themed constructions.
Bark blocks also come in all of the respective stairs and slab variants for your building needs.
A Wooden version of walls that has the log texture on all sides is also present.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.carve: Coming in all variants, it is a building block with minimal texture and that appears the same on all sides.\nUseful for cornerstones.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.charr: Darker Nether Bricks with a more burnt look.
Charred Nether Bricks also come in stairs and slab variant, with the exact same look.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.clay_: Terracotta Shingles are blocks that combine the colors of terracotta with a more textured look that resembles small tiles.
Terracotta Shingles also come in stairs and slab variant.
Terracotta Shingles also come in various different colors to satisfy your building needs.
Terracotta Shingles also come in various different colors in both full block, stairs and slab variants to satisfy your building needs.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.duskb: Purple looking lamp that blends perfecly with Duskbound Blocks.\n\nEmits the same amount of light of a Redstone Lamp.
A stairs and a slab version of the Duskbound Block is also provided.
Duskbound Walls are present, too.\nThey have the same purpur pattern as their "big brother".
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.magma: Magma Bricks also come in stairs and slab variants, with the same characteristics: they shine, but don't emit light.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.midor: Building blocks of Japanese origin that are the green counterpart to the vanilla Purpur blocks.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.more_: Variant of both Sandstone and Red Sandstone with more decoration patterns.
The new variants of Sandstone and Red Sandstone also come with stairs and slabs with matching decorations.
Building blocks that resemble bricks, made of various stone types.\n\nUseful for less repetitive buildings and for decorations.
Building blocks that have been chiseled in square patterns.\n\nUseful for decorations and as cornerstones.
The Stone Bricks also come in stair and slab variant, with the same texture and characteristics.\n\nUseful for decorations.
A wall version of the Stone Bricks is also provided, to fence areas and for decorative purpouses.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.nethe: A lighter but more chaotic version of the Nether Bricks, made from Netherrack.
A version of netherrack that has a smooth texture on all sides.\n\nUseful for cornerstones.
A lighter but more chaotic version of the Nether Bricks Stairs and Slab, made from Netherrack.
A wall made of Netherwrought in its chaotic form.\n\nUseful for buildings in the Nether.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.polis: A full block version of the Stone Slab, it has its polished texture on all sides.\n\nUseful for cornerstones, flooring, or stone pillars.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.quilt: Wool that has a frame around it.\n\nUseful for decorations.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.sandy: Brick variant that has a more sandy and washed out look.\n\nUseful for buildings in deserted areas.
Stairs and slab versions of the Sandy Bricks.\n\nUseful for buildings in deserted areas.
Wall made of Sandy Bricks, with a more sandy look.\n\nUseful for buildings in deserted areas.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.snow_: Brick variant of a snow block, however weird it sounds.\n\nUseful for buildings in tundras, taigas, or white lands.
Stairs and slab versions of the Snow Bricks.\n\nUseful for buildings in tundras, taigas, or white lands.
Wall made of pure white snow bricks.\n\nUseful for buildings in tundras, taigas, or white lands.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.soul_:
A variant of Sandstone made from Soul Sand.

It also comes in slab variant.

Useful for Nether themed creations.
A more decorated version of the Soul Sandstone.\n\nUseful for Nether themed creations.
Variant of the Soul Sandstone that comes in new decoration patterns.
The new variants of Soul Sandstone also come with stairs and slabs with matching decorations.
Soul Sandstone also comes in stairs form.\n\nUseful for Nether themed creations.
Soul Sandstone also has a wall version, which can be used among others in Nether themed creations.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.stain: Planks that are colored in various pastel tints, so not to hurt the eyes.
Stained Planks also come in all stairs and slab variants, with the same pastel colors.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.stone: Building block with a textured look that resembles lots of small bricks placed together in a grid.\n\nUseful for floorings.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.sugar: The Sugar Cane Block also comes in stair and slab variant.
A wall block for the Sugar Cane Block is featured, too.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.thatc: Thatch also comes in stairs and slab variants.\n\nThey negate a configurable percentage of fall damage, too.
Turf Blocks also come in Stair and Slab variant, with the same vibrant color.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.vanil: Half-height block that can be used as stairs, flooring, or decoration element on roofs, ceilings, and around windows.
Allows entities to walk over them and go up one block.\n\nIt can also be used as a decorative element on ceilings or roofs.
Decorative blocks that can be used to delimit areas.\n\nHigher than one block and with more blast resistance, no entity can pass through them.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.building.verti: Exactly like vanilla blocks, but with planks placed in the opposite direction.\n\nUseful to create different patterns in buildings.
Vertical Planks also come in stained colors, with pastel tints so not to hurt the eyes.\n\nUseful to break repeatitive patterns in buildings.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.decoration.all: Bookshelves are now available in every single wood variant.
Emits a restone signal when pressed or when hit by an arrow.\n\nAvailable in all wood types.
Emits a redstone signal when walked on or when hit by an arrow.\n\nAvailable in all wood types.
Used to store items instead of your inventory.\n\nAvailable in all wooden variants.
Like a Chest, but when open it emits a redstone signal.\n\nAvailable in all wooden variants.
Trapdoors are now available in all wooden variants.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.decoration.col: Flower Pots can be colored with the various dyes and match the color of the respective Stained Clay variant.
The background of the Item Frame gets colored with the matching dye color.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.decoration.net: Fence gate made of Nether Bricks.\n\nUseful for Nether-like buildings.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.decoration.pap: Connects seamlessly to fences to give a more aestethic, Japanese-like look.
A wall made of paper that resembles the Japanese building style.\n\nAlso available in a version decorated with peach trees.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.basalt.s: Basalt is also available in stairs and slab variants.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.basalt.w: A wall version of Basalt is also provided for all your building needs.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.crystal_: Pane version of the Crystal. Can only be used for building, but it shines light like the bigger brother.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.ender_bi: A very dark, almost black, block that is made of Biotite. It is also available in chiseled and pillar form, in both stairs and slabs.\n\nUseful for dark, End-themed buildings.
Stairs and Slabs made of Biotite.\n\nUseful for End-themed buildings or dark areas, thanks to their almost fully black color.
Wall made of biotite.\n\nIt has a dark black texture and is useful to fence areas in End-themed creations.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.stone_re: Jasper is also available in stairs and slabs variants, for your building needs.\n\nIt has the same orange texture.
Wall made of Jasper, useful to fence areas in old-style buildings.
Limestone is also provided in slab and stair variants for your building needs.
Wall made of limestone, useful to fence areas.
Marble also comes in stairs and slab variants, with the same pure white texture.
Pure white wall, can be used to fence areas in modern-style buildings.
The Slate comes also in slab and stairs variant, with the same blueish texture.\n\nIndicated for mountain-themed buildings.
Wall made of Slate, with its blueish texture.\n\nSuggested in particular for mountain-themed buildings.
dymm.doc.quark.decoration.world.undergro: Cobbedstone is also available in stair and slab form, for all your building needs.\n\nSuggested for dungeon-like creations.
Wall made out of Cobbedstone, which can be used to fence areas or as a decorative block in dungeon-like buildings.
Elder Prismarine can be crafted into bricks, which retain the same texture, but have a more polished aspect.\n\nSuggested for Ocean-themed creations.
Elder Prismarine Bricks also come in stair and slab variant, with the same polished texture.
Elder Prismarine Bricks can be crafted into a wall, which can then be used to fence areas in Ocean-themed buildings.
Combining Elder Prismarine with a black dye creates a darker form of Elder Prismarine, which has a darker, pink-er texture and is divided into small bricks.\n\nUseful for ocean-themed buildings.
Dark Elder Prismarine, much like its lighter counterpart, comes in stairs and slab variants.\n\nUsage of these blocks are suggested in buildings with an ocean-based theme.
Wall form of Dark Elder Prismarine, that can fence areas.\n\nSuggested for ocean-themed constructions.
Elder Prismarine can also be crafted into stairs and slab variants.\n\nUseful for ocean-themed bases and constructions.
Elder Prismarine comes with a wall form, that allows it to fence areas, especially in ocean-themed bases and constructions.
Brimstone can be crafted into bricks, which retain the same texture, but have a more polished aspect.\n\nSuggested for Nether-like or fiery-themed creations.
Brimstone Bricks are also available in stairs and slab variants, with the same bright orange texture.
Brimstone Bricks are available as a wall, which can be used to fence areas in fiery-themed or Nether-like constructions.
Brimstone is also available in stairs and slab variants, with the same bright orange texture.
Brimstone is available as a wall, which can be used to fence areas in fiery-themed or Nether-like buildings.
Permafrost is also available in Bricks form, with the same color, but a more polished texture.\n\nUseful for cold-themed buildings, such as Igloos.
Permafrost Bricks are also available in stairs and slab forms, with the same texture and the same look.
Permafrost Bricks come in wall form, too.\n\nThis is useful to fence areas in cold-themed constructions, such as Igloos.
Permafrost also comes in stairs and slab variants, with the same texture and the same Packed-Ice-like look.\n\nUseful for building bases in cold biomes.
Wall made of Permafrost, which is useful to fence areas in cold biomes or otherwise as a decorative element.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.better_shulker: 你可以將滑鼠停在界伏盒上查看其內容。
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.chest_searchin: You can search the content of the chest that is currently open and of your inventory with the search bar.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.enchanted_book: You can hover over an Enchanted Book in your inventory to see what types of item it can be enchanted with.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.food_tooltip.f: You can hover over an edible item in your inventory to see how much hunger it restores.\n\nNegative effects are signalled with a rotten food bar.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.improved_mount: Riding an entity won't hide the hunger bar anymore.\n\nFurthemore, the Horse jump bar will only be shown when you're jumping.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.improved_sign_: The sign edit GUI is replaced with a more intuitive version that uses text boxes.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.client.map_tooltip.ma: You can hover over a filled Map in your inventory to see its contents.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.misc.note_block_inter: Right clicking a Noteblock will open a piano-style interface. You can click on a piano key to set it to that note.\n\nYou can also press the eight leftmost letter keys on your keyboard to play the keys.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.management.chest_butt: The chest GUI also provides buttons that allow you to manipulate the contents.\n\nYou can sort the chest inventory or yours, drop all your items or only selected ones in the chest, or extract all the items or selected ones from the chest.
dymm.doc.quark.gui.management.dropoff_bu:
You can store the contents of your inventory (not hotbar, armor, and offhand) into nearby chests.

Pressing the Dropoff button while holding Shift will drop the items in chests that already contain them.

This feature can also be disabled through the `quark_allowDropoff` gamerule.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.chute.chut: When items are pushed into a Chute, the items get dropped out of the exact center of the bottom.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.color_slim: Colored Slime blocks will not move Slime blocks of other colors when moved by a Piston.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.ender_watc: Gives off a Redstone signal when being looked at.
Gravisand only falls when given a Redstone signal. If it gets a Redstone signal and it can't fall, it will float up.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.metal_butt: When pressed, emits a 2 tick long signal.
When pressed, emits a 5 second signal.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.obsidian_p: Only triggers when used by a Player.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.piston_blo: Breaks blocks when pushed into them with a Piston.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.redstone_i: The Redstone Inductor has 3 inputs and 1 output. It outputs a signal whose strength is the sum of all the inputs.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.redstone_r: When the Redstone Randomizer receives a signal, it randomly sends a signal to either its left or right outputs.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.sugar_bloc: Sugar Blocks will fall like Sand and Gravel, and disappear when they touch Water.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.automation.weather_se: Provides a signal when it's being rained on. Can be inverted by right clicking.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.framed_glass: Glass block that has a square pattern on all sides.\n\nUseful for windows in retro-styled buildings.
Pane version of the Framed Glass block.\n\nCan connect to vanilla Glass panes.
Iron Plates are building blocks that have a metallic look.\n\nThey are useful as cornerstones.
Iron Plates come in stair and slab variant.\n\nUseful for flooring or decorations in iron-themed buildings.
Version of the Iron Plate with a more rusty appearance.\n\nUseful for ruins or underwater buildings.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.magma_bricks: Brick block that shines between the bricks, but does not emit light.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.sturdy_stone: Sturdy Stone can't be pushed by Pistons.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.sugar_cane_b: A storage and building block made with Sugar Canes.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.thatch.thatc: Storage block for Wheat that can be used for building.\n\nNegates a configurable percentage of fall damage when entities fall on it.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.trowel.trowe: When used, places a random block from your hotbar.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.building.turf.turf: Block made of tall grass that has the Grass Block texture on all sides and doesn't transform into dirt when a block is on top.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.blaze_lant: Fire equivalent of the Sea Lantern, emits the maximum light level.\nUseful in Nether buildings or in warm-colored constructions.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.block_of_c: Blocks of Charcoal will burn forever, like Netherrack.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.glass_item: Disappears when an item is placed in it, so you can only see the item.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.iron_grate:
Items will fall through placed Grates.

Mobs will not walk over them.

This is pretty grate feature.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.iron_ladde: Iron Ladders can stand freely without a block behind them, as long as the top block does.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.leaf_carpe: Flat Carptet-like blocks that look like Leaves.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.rope.rope:
Rope Coils can be placed on the bottom of blocks and act like Ladders.

You can right click on the top block to place more on the bottom.

Once you've placed enough Rope Coils to reach the bottom, you can right click the top Rope with an empty hand to pull the block under the bottom Rope up to you.

You can also right click with a Rope Coil while a block is attatched to the bottom to lower it back down.

Breaking a Rope Coil will also break all Rope Coils beneath it.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.rope.rope_: Dispensers can place Rope on the bottom if there is already Rope at the top.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.decoration.tallow_and: Comes in all 16 colors. If there is no block underneath, it will fall like sand. Candles are equal to half a Bookshelf for Enchanting Tables.
Used to craft Candles.\n\nIt may be dropped by Pigs when they're killed.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.experimental.colored_: Placing a block of stained glass under a Lit Redstone Lamp will turn the light of the lamp to that color.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.experimental.framed_b: The Frame is a block that can assume the appearance of any other block.\n\nRight click it with another block to camouflage the frame into it.

The Frame Slab is a slab that can assume the appearance of any other block, whether full block or not. In the latter case, the texture will be cut in half.\n\nRight click it with another block to camouflage the frame into it.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.ancient_tomes.an: Rare loot in dungeons.\nCombine with an Enchanted Book of the same enchantment and level to create an Enchanted Book one level above the usual max, which can be applied to items.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.colored_runes.ru: Combine with enchanted items in an Anvil to change the color of the glow.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.enderdragon_scal: Craft with the Elytra to duplicate it.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.extra_arrows.end: Teleports the player to where it landed.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.extra_arrows.exp: Explodes where it hits.\nCan be fired from Dispensers.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.extra_arrows.tor: Places a Torch where it lands.\nCan be fired from Dispensers.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.extra_potions.da: Danger Sight will show particles on blocks where monsters can spawn.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.horse_whistles.m: When you use a Horse Whistle, nearby tamed Horses will teleport to you.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.horse_whistles.o: When you use a Horse Whistle, nearby tamed Horses will come to you.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.parrot_eggs.parr: Feeding Beetroot Seeds (or another seed if configured) to a Parrot has a chance to make it hatch a Parrot Egg, which can be thrown to get a guaranteed Parrot of the same color.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.pickarang.pickar: Breaks the block it hits when thrown, and returns with the drop.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.slime_in_a_bucke: Right click a Slime with a Bucket to put the Slime in a Bucket.\n\nWhile in your inventory, it will hop around when you are in a Slime chunk.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.soul_powder.soul: Right click in the Nether to create a spirit that will fly in the direction of the nearest Nether Fortress.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.misc.wither_ash.black: Monsters cannot spawn on Wither Ash, or on the block above Wither Ash.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.tweaks.glass_shards.g: When Glass is broken, it will drop some Glass Shards which can be crafted back into Glass.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.vanity.witch_hats.wit: Highly enchantable, and provides 50% resistance to Potions of Harming.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.archaeologist.a: The Archaeologist is a villager that lives in caves and trade in bones and other items.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.archaeologist.h: The Archaeologist Hat gives a chance to mine extra ores while worn.\n\nThis only applies to ores that are affected by the Fortune enchantment.
Archaeologist Hats can drop from Archaeologist, which have a chance of spawning underground.
You can buy the Archaeologist Hat from Archaeologists, which have a chance of spawning underground.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.basalt.basalt: Dark block that spawns in the Nether in large quantities. It is similar to Andesite and Diorite in behavior.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.cave_roots.root: Edible item that's dropped by Roots. It takes longer to eat, but it is a good source of emergency food while roaming in caves.
Acts exactly like the Vanilla dye of the corresponding color.\n\nCrafted from Sprouts.
Dropped by Roots that have flowers on them. They can be used as dyes or eaten for a quick source of food.

Roots are non-climbable vines that appear in caves.

They sometimes have flowers on them that can be harvested and used to make dyes.

If left in a dark enough area, they will grow and possibly create more Sprouts.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.crabs.cooked_cr: Food item obtained through cooking a Crab Leg. Replenishes almost half of the hunger bar.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.crabs.crab: They can be found on beaches.\n\nWhen killed they drop an edible item and a Crab Shell Fragment, which can be used to brew a Potion of Stability.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.crystal_caves.c: Obtained from Crystal Caves, rare underground formations that host Crystals and large amounts of ores.\n\nIt emits light and can be used to craft Runes.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.depth_mobs.ashe: A variant of Skeleton that lurks in the darkness at low Y levels (less than 20) and shoots blindness arrows. The effect lasts for 2.5 seconds.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.depth_mobs.dwel: Zombie variant that lurks in the darkness at low Y levels (less than 20).\n\nIt starts out invisible, but loses this ability once attacks or is attacked.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.ender_biotite.b: Obtained after mining Biotite Ore, so it can only be acquired after the Ender Dragon is defeated.\n\nUsed to brew Potions of Fortitude.
Biotite Ore generates on the main End island when an Ender Dragon dies.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.foxhounds.foxho:
Tameable but hostile mobs that spawn in the Nether. When they attack they set you on fire.

To tame them you can feed them coal, but be wary not to burn yourself to death.

They sleep on Magma blocks and they can heat up a furnace when sitting on top of it.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.frogs.cooked_fr: Food item obtained through cooking a Frog Leg. Replenishes two hunger points.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.frogs.frog: Spawn in Swamps. They eat fish and spider eyes. Their legs can be cooked or used to brew Jump Boost potions.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.frogs.golden_fr: Obtained from a Frog Leg. Can be eaten two replenish 2 points of hunger.\n\nIts best usage is in brewing, where it can be used to create Potions of Leaping.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.monster_boxes.m: The one use version of the Mob Spawner.\n\nThese blocks spawn randomly in caves and ignite when you get closer to them. They spawn a patch of mobs and then disappear.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.nether_smoker.s: Emits smoke if there is no block above it.\n\nIf there is a 1x1 chimney directly above it surrounded by solid blocks, the smoke will travel all the way to the top.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.pirates.pirate:
Spawns on Pirate ships in Ocean biomes.
They attack you on sight, resemble skeletons and do not despawn.

When killed, they rarely drop their Pirate Hat.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.pirate_ships.pi: Rarely dropped by Pirates when they're killed by a player.\n\nIt doesn't do much other than providing one full armor point and look cool.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.speleothems.spe:
Speleothems are formations that generate in caves. They can grow up to three blocks high and can be obtained only through Silk Touch.

Breaking the supporting block makes the entire structure fall apart.

Very useful for decorations.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stone_revamp.ja: Block with an orange texture that generates underground in sandy and mesa biomes.\n\nIts color is determined by the presence of silica in his composition.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stone_revamp.li: Block with a lime texture, which can be used for buildings.\n\nGenerates in huge patches underground in swamp and ocean biomes.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stone_revamp.ma: Marble is a light, white type of stone that generates underground in plains biomes.\n\nIt is very useful for modern-style buildings and can be used instead of Quartz in this case.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stone_revamp.sl:
Building block with a blue texture, similar to Ice.

It generates in patches underground in cold biomes.
Normally used for roofing, it is useful for mountain-themed buildings.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stonelings.diam: Has a chance of dropping from Stonelings.\n\nRight click on a Stone block to "create" your own, allowing it to hold your items, eat Stone, and follow you when you're holding a Diamond.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.stonelings.ston:
Stonelings are passive mobs that spawn underground and carry an item.

If you go closer to them without sneaking, they will get startled and run away and disappear eventually.

They can be "created" with a Heart of Diamond: in this case they'll carry your items and follow you. They eat Stone.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.underground_bio: Cobbedstone is a variant of Cobblestone that is covered in spider webs.\n\nIt spawns underground in Plains biomes or it can be crafted by combining Cobblestone and Spider Webs.

Block that spawns in Ocean-type biomes underground.

It has a more washed out look than Prismarine, but it resembles the Elder Guardian one.

Useful for ocean-themed bases.
Block that spawns in Ocean-type biomes underground.\n\nIt acts the same as a regular Sea Lantern, but it has a more washed out look that resembles the tones of the Elder Guardian.
Brimstone is a block that can spawn in Mesa biomes underground.\n\nIt has a very bright orange texture which makes it a good block when building Nether-like or fiery-themed creations.
Variant of Mycelium that spawns underground in Mountains or Mushroom Island biomes and emits light.\n\nIt is the best place for Glowshrooms to proliferate.

Fungus variant that grows on Glowcelium under Mountains or Mushroom Island biomes. As the name implies, it glows in the dark.\n\nIt can be used to create Mushroom Stew or to brew a Potion of Danger Sight.
Permafrost is a block that spawns underground in Cold biomes.
dymm.doc.quark.mod.world.wraiths_and_cur: Has a chance of dropping from Wraiths, which spawn in the Nether.\n\nWhen used, inflicts the Curse debuff for 10 minutes. Monsters will spawn regardless of light level around the player during that time.

Spawns in the Nether on Soul Sand and attacks in groups. Everytime you get it, you get Slowness and the Wraith knocks themself back.\n\nSince they're ghosts, they sound like other mobs, so don't trust your ears while roaming in the Nether.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.automation.dispen: Dispensers can plant seeds onto all kinds of soil.
Dispensers can place blocks into the world.
Dispensers can move Music Discs into and out of Jukeboxes.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.automation.hungry: Animals will eat food that's been dropped on the ground, so you can automate animal breeding with Droppers.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.automation.piston: Pistons can push and pull tile entities such as Furnaces and Chests.\n\nSome tile entities still can't be moved, like Mob Spawners.
When a Piston extends, it will launch items in the direction it's facing.
When a Sticky Piston retracts, it will pull items towards itself.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.client.angry_cree: Creepers turn red when they are about to explode.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.client.random_ani: The texture of this mob change randomly, to bring more variety in your Minecraft world.
Rarely, a mob will spawn with a "shiny" texture, which is radically different.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.client.subtler_sh: The handle of the shield is moved upwards, so that you can hold it without blocking the view in front of you.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.flat_i: Item Frames can be placed on floors and ceilings.\n\nThe top of the frame points North.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.more_b: Banners can have up to 16 layers.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.new_ba: There are new Banner motifs that can be made with Dragon Heads, Eyes of Ender, Iron Swords, and Iron Chestplates.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.place_: You can place Blaze Rods and they will give off light.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.tie_le: Leads can connect two Fences, instead of only a Fence and a Mob.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.decoration.unrest: The Flower Pot can host all kinds of flowers and saplings, even modded ones.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.experimental.parr: Interacting with a parrot will make it say Despacito.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.management.arrow_: Scrolling while sneaking and holding a Bow will rotate the position of arrows in the inventory.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.management.chests: Right click a Chest on a Boat to place it on the Boat.\n\nWhile in the Boat, opening your inventory will also open the Chest's inventory.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.management.shulke: While holding an item in your cursor, you can right click a Shulker Box in your inventory to directly insert it without having the Shulker Box down.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.animal_poiso: Feeding a baby animal a Poisonous Potato has a chance of poisoning it, which also prevents it from aging into an adult.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.endermites_i: Endermites have a chance of burrowing into Purpur Blocks, turning them into Shulkers.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.extra_potion: Increases mining and attack speed of 10% per level.\n\nCan be brewed with Prismarine Crystals.
Decreases mining and attack speed of 10% per level.\n\nCan be obtained by brewing a Fermented Spider Eye with a Potion of Haste.
Decreases damage taken by 20% per level.\n\nCan be brewed with Biotite or Quartz.
You can craft a Map with an Ink Sac to place an unremovable marker at your current position.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.monster_note: If a Noteblock has a mob head on it, it will emit that its noise at the pitch set by the Noteblock.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.place_glowst: Can be placed like Redstone Dust to emit light, similar to a Torch.
Can be placed like Redstone Dust and ignited with a Flint and Steel. The Fire will spread along the Gunpowder at 2 blocks a second.\n\nPlacing on Netherrack makes it go twice as fast.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.misc.throwable_dr: Can be thrown to replace nearby Stone with End Stone.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.armed_armo: Right click on the arms of the armor stand to lay or pickup tools and shields.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.axe_leaf_h: Axes will very quickly cut through Leaves.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.burning_ba: Baby Zombies burn in the sun.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.chicken_sh: Chickens can be sheared for 1 Feather, dealing half a heart of damage.\n\nSheared Chickens will not drop Feathers when killed.
Chickens will occasionally drop Feathers, similarly to Eggs.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.compasses_: While in the Nether or End, Compasses will point towards the Portal that took you there.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.dirt_to_pa: Right clicking with a shovel turns Dirt into a Path, without having to wait for it to become Grass.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.double_doo: Doors placed together will open together.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.effective_: The Bottle is not kept when Dragon Breath used in brewing recipies.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.enderman_a: On Hard difficulty, Endermen will pick up blocks you're hiding under and drop them aside to attack you.\nThis works when you're under a 2 blocks tall ceiling.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.hoe_harves: Hoes will break blocks in a 3x3 area.\nDiamond Hoes will break blocks in a 5x5 area.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.improved_s: Server admins can set it so only a percentage of players have to be asleep to skip the night instead of requiring everyone sleep.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.jump_boost: Having Jump Boost II will allow you to step up blocks without having to jump.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.knock_on_d: You can knock on doors by punching them.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.ladder_dro: Using a Ladder on a Ladder will place it at the bottom.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.ladder_sli: You can quickly slide down Ladders by looking down.\n\nYou will also stop on Ladders if you open your inventory or chat.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.minecart_b: You can convert a Minecart to one containing a block by interacting with it with the respective block.\nE.g., you can create a Minecart with Chest by right-clicking a Minecart with a Chest.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.pat_the_do: You can pat dogs.\n\nPatting a tamed Foxhound will set you on fire.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.quick_armo: Sneak right click an Armor Stand to swap all of your armor and the item in your offhand.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.right_clic: You can right click fully grown crops to harvest and replant them without breaking the block.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.shave_snow: Snow Layers can be shaved off one by one by right-clicking with a Shovel.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.sheep_armo: Sheep that have wool also have some armor added to them.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.sign_editi: You can right click a placed Sign to edit it.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.sponges_dr: Wet Sponges dry in the Nether.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.springy_sl: Slime Blocks bounce off entities that hit them from the side too.\n\nItems bounce too.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.squid_inki: When a Squid is attacked, it will release ink, which will blind nearby players.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.tweaks.villagers_: Archaeologists will follow players holding either a Block of Emerald or a Bone Block.
Villagers will follow players holding a Block of Emerald.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.vanity.boat_sails: Right click a Banner on a Boat to add it as a decorative sail.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.vanity.dyed_item_: Combine any item with a dye in the Anvil to color its name in the tooltip.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.vanity.firework_d: You can duplicate fireworks in a Banner-like manner, by combining them with an empty firework.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.vanity.stair_chai: You can sit on any Stairs that are facing upwards by right clicking them with an empty hand.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.big_mushroo: Big Mushrooms of both types generate in Swamp biomes.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.blazes_in_t: Blazes can spawn naturally in the Nether, even outside Nether Fortresses.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.buried_trea: You may find a Treasure Map in dungeon loot that points to Buried Treasures around the map.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.guardians_i: Guardians can spawn randomly (but rarely) in Deep Ocean biomes, even without an Ocean Monument nearby.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.nether_foss: Fossils can now spawn in the Nether, too.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.pathfinder_: Cartographer Villagers may trade you a Pathfinder Map, which points to the location of the nearest biome in the tooltip.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.tree_varian: Blossoming Trees seldom generate in Mountain biomes.\n\nThey have Spruce wood and pink leaves which are good for decorations.
dymm.doc.quark.vanilla.world.underground: Clay generates in random patches underground, similar to Dirt.
dymm.doc.quarkoddities.mod.oddities.back: Adds an additional 3x9 space to your inventory when equipped in the Chest slot.\n\nYou can also combine it with dyes to change its color.
Note that you will not be able to take it off if you have items inside of it.
To obtain it, trade with a Leatherworker at your nearest village: they may like some leather and emeralds.
dymm.doc.quarkoddities.mod.oddities.tiny: Can hold one item, plus it can be patted via right-click.
dymm.doc.quarkoddities.mod.oddities.tote:
When you die, a Totem of Holding is spawned, with all the inventory contents.

This totem can be located using the Soul Compass.

Note that if you die again, the Totem of Holding will break.
Enchanting an item now requires to mix and match pieces on the enchanting table.

The pieces can be generated up to a certain limit, given by the amount of bookshelves and candles arount the table.

Pieces can be rotated and upgraded, by clicking over them with other pieces that represent the same enchantment.
dymm.mod.configuration.refinedstorage.to: Allows you to configure settings that are specific to Refined Storage
dymm.mod.configuration.refinedstorage.ex: Experimental options to ease compatibility with Refined Storage.\nWARNING: They may not work correctly or cause errors; enable with care.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.constructor: Places blocks/fluids or drops items from the storage system in the world.\nSet what to place/drop in its GUI.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.controller:
The brain of the storage system.
All other blocks in the network must be connected to the Controller, either by touching directly or connected via Cable.

Energy should be provided through the Controller. You can open the Controller's GUI to see how much energy the system is using.

You can only have one Controller in a system at a time.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.cover: Hides Cables by making them look like a different block on that side. Also blocks connections to other devices.\n\nCrafted by combining a Cutting Tool with a block.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.crafter:
Crafts items according to recipes set by the Patterns inside them.

A Crafter facing a block will try to use that block for processing recipes.
A Crafter facing another Crafter will try to use the block that that Crafter is facing.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.crafter_manager: The Crafter Manager allows you to see the Patterns in all Crafters connected to the Controller.\n\nCrafters connected to machines will be named after that machine, and Crafters that have been renamed in an Anvil will have that name.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.crafting_monitor: Shows all currently running crafting tasks in the system.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.crafting_pattern: Stores crafting recipes, set in the Pattern Grid.\n\nGoes in a Crafter.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.cutting_tool: Craft the Cutting Tool with a block to make Covers of that block.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.destructor:
Breaks the block/fluid in front of it and puts them in the storage system.
You can set a whitelist or a blacklist and if it works with items or fluids in its GUI.
You can also set it to pick up items instead of breaking blocks.

You can give it enchantments with Upgrades.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.detector: Detectors emit a Redstone signal if the amount of a specified item/fluid is greater, lower, or exactly a specific amount.\n\nSet the item/fluid, the amount, and the criteria in its GUI.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.disk_drive: Stores Storage Disks and Fluid Storage Disks.\n\nHigher priority Disk Drives will get items before lower priority Disk Drives.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.disk_manipulator: The Disk Manipulator can quickly move items/fluids into or out of Storage Disks from the storage network.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.exporter:
Pulls items/fluids out of the storage system and puts them into the inventory it is facing.

You can set a whitelist or a blacklist and if it works with items or fluids in its GUI.
You can also set to ignore NBT and metadata.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.filter:
Can be inserted into Grids to only show items according to its filter.

Edit the filter by right clicking it and adding items/fluids.
You can set it to be a whitelist or a blacklist.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.fluid_interface: Fluids inserted into a Fluid Interface instantly go into the syste.\n\nYou can set fluids that will be provided to the Interface, which can be extracted by some other means.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.crafter_pat:
Allows you to set Patterns for Crafters. Pattens go in the top slot on the right.

If the recipe is a regular crafting recipe, just put it in the 3x3 crafting grid and then click the arrow on the right.

If it's a special recipe (like a Furnace recipe), click the Processing checkbox and then tell it the inputs and the outputs.

You can click the Oredict checkbox to allow it to use the Ore Dictionary.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.crafting: Functions like the Grid, but has a 3x3 crafting grid.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.explorer: Open the Grid to access items stored in the system.\nYou can search for specific items in the search bar at the top.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.fluid:
Open the Grid to access fluids storad in the system.

Insert fluids by dragging a filled Bucket into it.
Extract fluids by clicking on a fluid while you have an empty Bucket either in your inventory or in the storage network.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.portable: Works like a backpack combined with a Grid when you insert a Storage Disk in the top right slot (or a Fluid Grid, if you insert a Fluid Storage Disk).
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.wireless_fl: Acts like the Fluid Grid, but works anywhere in range of a Wireless Transmitter.\n\nSpecify the storage system to connect to by right clicking the Wireless Fluid Grid on the Controller.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.grid.wireless_cr: Acts like the Grid, but works anywhere in range of a Wireless Transmitter.\n\nSpecify the storage system to connect to by right clicking the Wireless Grid on the Controller.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.hollow_cover: Like the Cover, but it can connect to other devices.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.importer: Pulls items/fluids out of the inventory it is facing and puts them into the storage system.\n\nYou can set a whitelist or a blacklist and if it works with items or fluids in its GUI.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.interface: Items inserted into an Interface instantly go into the system.\n\nYou can set items that will be provided to the Interface, which can be extracted by some other means.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.network_card: Right click the Network Card on the Network receiver, then insert it into the Network Transmitter to connect them.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.network_receiver: Network Transmitters connect to Network Receivers that have their Network Card. This allows the Network Receiver to connect to the Controller at the main location from anywhere else.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.network_transmit: Network Transmitters connect to Network Receivers that have their Network Card. This allows the Network Receiver to connect to the Controller at the main location from anywhere else.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.reader:
Readers can take items, fluids, energy, and/or Redstone signals, move it through the system, and then output it at the connected Writer.

Open the Reader and create a name for it, then select it out of the list.

Readers do not automatically extract items or fluids, you have to insert them with some form of automation (Hoppers etc).
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.relay: Relays act like Cables that disconnect when given a Redstone signal.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.security_card: Can be bound to a player by right clicking and then inserted into a Security Manager to set their permissions.\n\nIf there is no player bound, it will set the permissions for players that don't have a bound Security Card.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.security_manager:
Stores Security Cards, and allows you to set permissions for them.

Configure a player's Security Card by inserting it into the bottom slot. Checked boxes are things that they are allowed to do.

Only Security Cards in the top slots will be checked.

Players without a Security Card have all permissions. You can change this by setting the permissions for an unbound Security Card and keeping it in one of the top slots.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.storage_block.fl: Stores 64,000 mB (64 buckets) of fluid.\n\nEssentially a 64k Fluid Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 256,000 mB (256 buckets) of fluid.\n\nEssentially a 256k Fluid Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 1,024,000 mB (1,024 buckets) of fluid.\n\nEssentially a 1024k Fluid Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 4,096,000 mB (4,096 buckets) of fluid.\n\nEssentially a 4096k Fluid Storage Disk in block form.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.storage_block.it: Stores 1,000 items.\n\nEssentially a 1k Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 4,000 items.\n\nEssentially a 4k Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 14,000 items.\n\nEssentially a 16k Storage Disk in block form.
Stores 64,000 items.\n\nEssentially a 64k Storage Disk in block form.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.storage_disk.flu: Stores 64,000 mB (64 buckets) of fluid.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 256,000 mB (256 buckets) of fluid.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 1,024,000 mB (1024 buckets) of fluid.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 4,096,000 mB (4,069 buckets) of fluid.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.storage_disk.ite: Stores 1,000 items.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 4,000 items.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 16,000 items.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
Stores 64,000 items.\n\nGoes in the Disk Drive.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.storage_monitor:
Shows the current amount of a specific item in the storage system.

Sneak right click with an empty hand and insert an item to make it show the amount of that item.

Right click with that item to insert it directly to the system, and left click to extract it.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.upgrade.crafting: Allows devices such as the Exporter to automatically craft items if there are none in the system.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.upgrade.range: Increases the range of a Wireless Transmitter by 8 blocks each.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.upgrade.silk_tou: Enchants the Destructor with Silk Touch.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.upgrade.speed: Increases the speed of the devices it is installed on.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.upgrade.stack: Allows devices like the Importer/Exporter to move stacks of an item at once instead of one at a time.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.wireless_craftin: Acts like the Crafting Monitor, but works anywhere in range of a Wireless Transmitter.\n\nSpecify the storage system to connect to by right clicking the Wireless Crafting Monitor on the Controller.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.wireless_transmi: When placed on a Cable, the Wireless Transmitter will allow Wireless Grids to connect to it.\n\nIt has a range of 16 blocks, but can be upgraded with Range Upgrades.
dymm.doc.refinedstorage.writer:
Writers can take items, fluids, energy, and/or Redstone signals from connected Readers and then output it to to the world.

Open the Writer and select the name that the Reader is set to.

The Writer does not automatically insert items or fluids into the block in front of it, you have to extract them with some form of automation (Hoppers etc).
dymm.doc.refinedstorageaddons.wireless_c: Acts like the Crafting Grid, but works anywhere in range of a Wireless Transmitter.\n\nSpecify the storage system to connect to by right clicking the Wireless Crafting Grid on the Controller.
dymm.doc.tbone.fast_leaf_decay: Leaves decay quicker when not attached to a log.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.fancy_frame_glass: Disappears when an item is placed in it, so you can only see the item.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.gadget.efln: Can be thrown, exploding into a giant crater where it lands.\n\nItems do not get destroyed by the explosion.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.gadget.glowball: Can be thrown, creates a light source where it lands.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.gadget.slime_boots: Removes all falling damage and makes you bounce.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.gadget.slime_channel: Pushes all entities in the direction it is flowing.\n\nYou can also place them on walls and ceilings!
dymm.doc.tconstruct.gadget.slimesling: Hold right click and release while looking at a block to be flung in the opposite direction.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.durability: Adds a 20% chance to not consume durability.\n\nA tool with Reinforced V has infinite durability, and projectiles with Reinforced V will never run out.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.mending: Created by using a Ball of Moss on a Bookshelf.\n\nGradually repairs tools using experience.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.silk_touch: Adds Silk Touch to the tool.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.steal_life: Heals you when you damage mobs.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.tall: Adds 1 block to the vertical radius for breaking blocks.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.modifier.wide: Adds 1 block to the horizontal radius for breaking blocks.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.moms_spaghetti: Add Beetroot Soup "sauce" and any three cooked meats in the Tool Station to fully prepare it.\n\nCan be eaten 100 times.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.piggybackpack: Right click on a mob to pick it up, equipping the item in your Chestplate slot.\n\nTake the Piggybackpack out of your Chestpalte slot to put the mob back down.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.crafting_stati: Works like a Crafting Table, but items stay in it when you close the it.\n\nYou can also open any Chests or other inventories if they are touching the Crafting Station.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.part_builder: The Part Builder allows you to make non-metal parts using tool part Patterns.\n\nYou can make the Part Builder out of any Logs, but this is only aesthetic.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.part_chest: The Part Chest can hold a large amount of tool parts.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.pattern_chest: The Pattern Chest can hold every tool part Pattern.\n\nIf placed next to a Part Builder, you will be able to see all the Pattern Chest's Patterns from inside it.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.stencil_table: The Stencil Table is where you turn turn Blank Patterns into tool part Patterns.\n\nYou can make the Stencil Table out of any Planks, but this is only aesthetic.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.tool_forge:
Allows you to make all tools.
You can make the Tool Forge out of any block of metal, but this is only aesthetic.

The tools it can make that the Tool Station can't are:
Hammer
Excavator
Lumber Axe
Scythe
Cleaver
Longbow
Crossbow
Bolt
Shuriken
dymm.doc.tconstruct.table.tool_station:
Allows you to make simple tools.

The tools it can make are:
Pickaxe
Shovel
Hatchet
Mattock
Kama
Broadsword
Longsword
Rapier
Frying Pan
Battlesign
Shortbow
Arrow
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.arrow: Fired from Shortbows and Longbows.\n\nDamage depends more on the Bow than the Arrow in general.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.battlesign:
Lower damage.
Lower speed.
Can be used as a shield in either hand. 
Reflects projectiles in the direction you're facing when holding right click.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.bolt:
Fired from Crossbows.
Ignores 50% of armor.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.broadsword:
Average damage.
Average speed.
Can use offhand.
Can hit multiple nearby enemies if attack cooldown is completed.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.cleaver:
High damage.
Low speed.
Can't use offhand.
Has Beheading II by default.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.crossbow:
Fires Bolts.
Long range.
Slow reloading and needs to be reloaded after each shot.
High damage.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.excavator:
Breaks soft blocks like Dirt in a 3x3 area.

Can right click on Grass to make Grass Paths in a 3x3 area.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.frypan:
Average damage.
Average speed.
Can't used offhand.
High knockback.
Can hold right click and release to deal more damage and automatically cook drops.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.hammer:
Breaks stone-based blocks in a 3x3 area.

Does extra damage to undead mobs.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.kama: Can be used as Shears.\n\nRight clicking on crops and Sugarcane harvests and replants all fully grown plants in an area.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.longbow:
Fires slower.
Much higher damage.
Long range.

Works best with heavier arrows.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.longsword:
Higher damage.
Lower speed.
Can't use offhand.
Can hold right click and release to jump in that direction.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.lumberaxe: Chops down entire trees at once.\n\nCan only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.mattock: Breaks Wood and Dirt, can be used as a Hoe.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.rapier:
Lower damage.
Higher speed.
Can't use offhand.
Can right click to hop backwards.
Ignores 50% of enemy armor.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.scythe:
Breaks plants in a 3x3 area. Right clicking on crops and Sugarcane harvests and replants all fully grown plants in an area.

Hits mobs in an area.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.shortbow:
Fires faster and has faster movement speed while using compared to vanilla Bow.
Short range.

Works best with lighter Arrows.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool.shuriken:
Short range.
Can be thrown from offhand.

Can only be made in the Tool Forge.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.tool_part.bolt_core: Bolt Cores are made by putting Arrow Shafts into the Casting Table and pouring the head material onto it.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.world.nether_slime_i: Spawn on Nether Slime Islands, which randomly generate on the surface of the Nether's Lava ocean.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.world.overworld_slim: Spawn on Slime Islands, which randomly generate floating in the air in the Overworld.
dymm.doc.tconstruct.world.slime_sapling: Grows into a tree made of Congealed Slime.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.aurora_block: Make up the Aurora Palace on Glaciers.\n\nConstantly change color.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.block_and_chain: When used, throws a projectile that returns to you after going a certain distance.\n\nDeals 5 hearts of damage, and destroys any blocks it touches.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.castle_door: Right click a Castle Door and all connected Castle Doors will temporarily disappear, allowing entites to walk through them.\n\nAlso activates when given a Redstone signal.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.charm.half_life: Found in random chests.\n\nPrevents death once while anywhere in your inventory, healing you to 4 hearts and giving Restoration for 10 seconds.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.charm.hand_keepi: Found in random chests or dropped from Maze Slims.\n\nWhen you die, you spawn with your armor and the whatever you're holding in each hand, so long as the Charm is anywhere in your inventory. This destroys the Charn.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.charm.hotbar_kee: When you die, you spawn with your armor and everything in your hotbar, as long as the Charm is anywhere in your inventory. This destroys the Charm.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.charm.inventory_: When you die, you spawn with your entire inventory, as long as the Charm is anywhere in your inventory. This destroys the Charm.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.charm.regen_life: Prevents death once while anywhere in your inventory, healing you to full health. It also gives you Restoration IV, Resistance, and Fire Resistance for 30 seconds.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.cicada:
Randomly generates on trees in the Twilight Forest.

Occasionally makes a loud noise.

Can be worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.crumble_horn: Given after giving the Questing Ram a Wool of every color.\n\nWhile being used, it will "crumble" nearby blocks. Stone will turn into Cobblestone, which turns into Gravel, etc.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.ender_bow: Can be found in the Aurora Palace.\n\nWhen you shoot a mob, it will swap your positions.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.experiment_one_h: Found in Dark Tower chests.\n\nFood item that restores a small amount of hunger. If you place 8 down on the ground and then click some Redstone on it, it will slowly regenerate when eaten.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.fire_jet.encased: Emits a pillar of fire when given a Redstone signal.\n\nIt does not need Lava source blocks beneath it.
Emits smoke particles from the top when given a Redstone signal.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.fire_jet.swamp_n: Can be found in Fire Swamps.\n\nOccasionally emits a pillar of fire, using up a Lava source block in a 3x3 area beneath it.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.fire_jet.swamp_s: Can be found in Fire Swamps.\n\nConstantly emits smoke particles from the top.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.firefly:
Randomly generate on trees in the Twilight Forest.

Act as a light source.

Can be worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.glass_sword: Can be found in the Aurora Palace.\n\nDoes 20 hearts of damage, but breaks after a single use.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.ice_bow: Can be found in the Aurora Palace.\n\nInflicts Frosted III on targets for 10 seconds, slowing them down. Can be repaired with Packed Ice in an Anvil.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.ice_sword: Can be found in the Aurora Palace.\n\nInflicts Frosted III on victims for 10 seconds, slowing them down. Can be repaired with Packed Ice in an Anvil.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.lamp_of_cinders: Found in the Giant Obsidian vault in Troll Caves.\n\nBurns Thorns.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.magic_beans:
Found in Obsidian vaults in Troll Caves.

When planted on Uberous Soil, they grow into giant bean stalks that you can climb up to cloud-level.

Useful for reaching the Cloud Cottage.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.map.magic: Shows the nearby biomes and structures in the Twilight Forest.\n\nVery useful for finding bosses.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.map.maze: Shows the layout of the world around you at your current depth. Useful for finding your way through the Labyrinth.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.map.maze_focus: Found in chests in the Labyrinth.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.map.ore: Shows the locations of ores at the depth it was first used in.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.moonworm_queen:
Found in Hollow Hill chests.

When charged and released, shoots out a glowing Moonworm that attaches to whatever block it hits, acting like a light source.

When it runs out of Moonworms, you can fill it back up with 3 Torchberries.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.ore_magnet:
Found in Hollow Hill chests.

When charged and released on the ground, it brings nearby ores to the surface.

Has only 12 durability, so you may want to enchant it with Mending.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.peacock_fan:
Rarely found in medium/large Hollow Hills.

Blows away entities when used.

When used while jumping, it flings you into the air.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.scepter.lifedrai:
Can drop from the Lich.

Drains 1-4 health from the mob you use it on, giving the health to you.

When it runs out of charges, it can be recharged with a Fermented Spider Eye.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.scepter.shield:
Can drop from the Lich.

Summons 5 floating shields around yourself or the targeted entity. Shields will negate all damage, but break after.

When it runs out of charges, it can be recharged with a Golden Apple.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.scepter.twilight:
Can drop from the Lich.

Shoots out a projectile that deals 2.5 hearts of damage.

When it runs out of charges, it can be recharged with an Ender Pearl.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.scepter.zombie:
Can drop from the Lich.

Spawns an allied Zombie to defend you. They die after 60 seconds.

When it runs out of charges, it can be recharged with Rotten Flesh and a Potion of Strength.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.seeker_bow: Can drop from the Snow Queen.\n\nArrows shot will bend towards hostile mobs.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_device.ant: Anti-builders spawn in certain rooms in the Dark Tower. They will prevent you from building or breaking blocks in a 9x9x9 area around themselves, until they are broken.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_device.car: When a Carminite Builder gets a Redstone signal, it will start building a bridge in the direction you are facing. You can walk along it and it will turn if you turn your head.\n\nAfter reaching its limit (17 blocks), it will slowly disappear starting at the Builder.
Surround with Redstone Blocks for a good time.\n\nDISCLAIMER: we are not responsible for loss of life or property.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_device.gha: Ghast Traps are very useful in the fight against the Ur-Ghast.\n\nKill the Carminite Ghastlings around the traps to charge them, then wait for the Ur-Ghast to fly above it. Give it a Redstone signal and it will deal massive damage.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_device.rea: Right click a Reappearing Block and all connected Reappearing Blocks will temporarily disappear, allowing entities to walk through them.\n\nAlso activates when given a Redstone signal.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_device.van: Right click a Vanishing Block and all connected Vanishing Blocks will permanently disappear.\n\nAlso activates when given a Redstone signal.
Act like Vanishing Blocks, but you need to unlock them with a Tower Key. Explore the surrounding area in the dungeon to find them.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.tower_key: Unlocks Locked Vanishing Blocks. Find them by exploring the area surrounding the locked pathway.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.transformation_p:
Found in treasure chests in Hollow Hills.

Swaps mobs between their Overworld and Twilight Forest versions.

Cow ⬌ Deer
Pig ⬌ Boar
Sheep ⬌ Bighorn Sheep
Bat ⬌ Raven
Chicken ⬌ Penguin
Spider ⬌ Hedge Spider
Cave Spider ⬌ Swarm Spider
Blaze ⬌ Wraith
Villager ⬌ Redcap Goblin
Witch ⬌ Skeleton Druid
Zombie Pigman ⬌ Minotaur
dymm.doc.twilightforest.triple_bow: Can drop from the Snow Queen.\n\nShoots three vertically-alligned arrows.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.hydra: Dropped by the Hydra.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.knight_ph: Dropped by Knight Phantoms.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.lich: Dropped by the Lich.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.minoshroo: Dropped by the Minoshroom.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.naga: Dropped by the Naga.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.questing_: Given after giving the Questing Ram a Wool of every color.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.snow_quee: Dropped by the Snow Queen.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy.ur_ghast: Dropped by the Ur-Ghast.\n\nCan be placed or worn on your head.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.trophy_pedestal: Trophy Pedestals block the way into the Goblin Knight Stronghold.\n\nPlace a boss Trophy on top of the Pedestal to open the door, letting you in.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.twilight_sapling:
Can be found in Leaf Dungeons.

The area around tree will slowly turn into an Enchanted Forest biome. Can be toggled by right clicking on the Heart of Transformation block.

Breaking the Heart of Transformation block will destroy it.

Can be found in Leaf Dungeons.

The Miner's Tree will slowly pull ores from the surrounding area towards itself, like the Ore Magnet. Can be toggled by right clicking on the Minewood Core block.

Breaking the Minewood Core block will destroy it.

Can be found in Leaf Dungeons.

The Sorting Tree will search all nearby chests and combine items into stacks. Can be toggled by right clicking on the Sortingwood Engine block.

Breaking the Sortingwood Engine block will destroy it.

Can be found in Leaf Dungeons.

Speeds up plant growth around itself. Can be toggled by right clicking on the Timewood Clock block.

Breaking the Timewood Clock block will destroy it.
dymm.doc.twilightforest.uncrafting_table: Allows you to uncraft an item, destroying it and returning the items used to make it.\n\nUncrafting takes a level of experience per item gained.
dymm.doc.waystones.bound_scroll:
The Bound Scroll teleports you to the Waystone you've bound it to.

Bind the Scroll to a Waystone by holding sneak and right clicking on it.

This uses up the Scroll.
dymm.doc.waystones.return_scroll: The Return Scroll teleports you to the most recent Waystone you've used.\n\nThis uses up the Scroll.
dymm.doc.waystones.warp_scroll: The Warp Scroll allows you to teleport to any Waystone you've ever used from anywhere.\n\nThis uses up the Scroll.
dymm.doc.waystones.warp_stone: The Warp Stone allows you to teleport to any Waystone you've ever used from anywhere.\n\nThis does not use up the Stone, but it has a fairly long cooldown.
dymm.doc.waystones.waystone: You can teleport between all Waystones you've ever used, at the cost of experience depending on distance.
